page.title: 14LANDUSE CONTINUED
page.content: Old farms have been amalgamated to make a large farm estate, owned by City firms as investments and farmed by an agricultural expert living locally. Other farmhouses are either used by farmworkers or sold off. Many field hedges and coppices have been grubbed out to make fields of 15-30 ha.,with the loss of much wildlife habitat. Phasel's Wood is owned by the Scout Movement and used as a permanent campsite for all their members, and this is constantly in use at weekends and in school holidays. Smaller fields within the 'Green belt' have been sold for grazing to owners of the many horses regularly ridden in this area.This has given rise to the term 'horsiculture' which uses agricultural land and palatial stables and jumps are built on it,but no houses are allowed.
